title: Does anyone have an insider's view on why so many medical colleges are being de-recognised?
selftext:
[https://www.theweek.in/news/health/2023/05/31/as-150-medical-colleges-are-set-to-lose-nmc-recognition-is-a-crisis-looming-in-health-sector.html](https://www.theweek.in/news/health/2023/05/31/as-150-medical-colleges-are-set-to-lose-nmc-recognition-is-a-crisis-looming-in-health-sector.html)  


I initially thought it was great that colleges were being hauled up for flouting rules. About time. But on a closer look, it seems like the cited reasons include inadequate CCTV cameras and lack of Aadhar-based biometric attendance systems. While I'm a complete layperson, it seems very odd that these things are important enough to warrant de-recognition.   


Do any of you know what's really going on, here?
comments:
OP,

For the most part it's just these colleges make huge revenue thru donation, management seats etc. 

When the colleges then have the money to spend it on the same infrastructure you listed out and more but they don't because the Management is busy Lining their pockets with the same money. I am sure you get the GIST of it all now don't you OP. 

It's happened to few of the Med Schools in my district - people got arrested, management people got fired and even a complete overhaul for the management as well.

>"However, what happened is that all medical colleges do not have adequate number of faculties which is required according to the NMC rules. So, the education in the medical faculty is getting hampered.”

Lack of faculty may have been the primary reason.
